reviewText: A very special and well produced collection of some of the best documentary works available. Each documentary is unique and the stories and history well told by great characters/subjects and narrators.

It's a great collection but even with a good vocabulary in english the legends would help a lot.
I only received this item more than two moths later.

I've seen each of these fine films over the years and was ecstatic when I found I could own all four in a nice 5-disc DVD boxed set.  Each is such an important piece of history that everyone, especially the GLBT community, should know about  Being shipped from Australia to the USA...can hardly wait until they get here.
This is an excellent collection that every high school & college should show. The Times of Harvey Milk will remind people why San Francisco is thinking about renaming SFO after Harvey.

got the dvd fast. I wanted to see The Celluloid Closet and got the other movies in the box set as a bonus, it was cheaper for all 4 movies than just 1. Very informative flicks, glad i saw them all. FERGY

This is a good collection of well-done documentaries, including the academy-award winning "The Times of Harvey Milk."  "Paragraph 175" is dark due to it's subject, but the "Celluloid Closet" is fun in a lighter vein.
